title: AI strengthens agility and engagement
description: As businesses navigate increasingly dynamic markets, artificial intelligence (AI) is emerging not just as a tool, but as a strategic driver of marketing agility and firm performance. New research by Edith Cowan University (ECU) has found that by leveraging AI technologies, firms can become AI ready and respond more quickly to changing stakeholder preferences, optimise campaigns in real time, and deliver highly personalised experiences that strengthen stakeholder engagement.

title: Unlock Innovation: Neo and SpoonOS Host $8K AI Hackathon in Seoul
description: BitcoinWorldUnlock Innovation: Neo and SpoonOS Host $8K AI Hackathon in SeoulGet ready, Seoul! The blockchain and AI worlds are colliding in an electrifying event. Layer 1 blockchain Neo and the innovative Web3 agentic operating system, SpoonOS, have just announced a major collaboration. They are hosting the ‘Scoop AI Hackathon: Seoul Bowl,’ a groundbreaking event with an $8,000 prize pool dedicated to merging artificial intelligence with [...]This post Unlock Innovation: Neo and SpoonOS Host $8K AI Hackathon in Seoul first appeared on BitcoinWorld.

title: China’s AI sector poised for growth despite US tech restrictions, venture capitalist says
description: China’s artificial intelligence still needs to improve in six aspects, from ecosystem to funding, but the emergence of DeepSeek has significantly boosted the sector’s confidence in overcoming US restrictions, according to a mainland venture capital firm.China and the US were the two top players...

title: Disney’s AI deal and the clanker’s true intentions
description: Disney recently inked a $1 billion deal with OpenAI, following a string of investments across several media industries

title: For Singapore, the real AI race is institutional, not just technological
description: For years, the global race for artificial intelligence has been framed as a contest between Washington and Beijing. The United States commands the frontier models, cloud ecosystems, and venture capital that shape global innovation; China, backed by scale, engineers, and state coordination, is catching up fast. But the world’s next frontier for AI power will [...]The post For Singapore, the real AI race is institutional, not just technological appeared first on e27.
